alert.note: Alert for San Benito (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 04 at 6:05PM PST until January 04 at 11:45PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Francisco has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... A Dam Floodgate Release in... Northwestern San Benito County in central California... * Until 1145 PM PST. * At 605 PM PST, dam operators reported the spillway of the North Fork Dam is compromised. It is perceived that water will overtop the spillway by tomorrow morning. Flash flooding may occur immediately downstream in the vicinity of Lovers Lane. Increased flows into Pacheco Creek would also occur. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding from a dam floodgate release. SOURCE...Dam operator. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas along the creek immediately downstream of the dam. This includes Lovers Lane. * The nearest downstream location is Lovers Lane. This includes the following streams and drainages... Santa Ana Creek. Flooding is occurring along the Pacheco Pass Reservoir. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: If you are in low lying areas below the North Fork Dam you should move to higher ground immediately. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
